org.jpws.pwslib.persist

Class AbstractFTPAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.persist.AbstractFTPAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ApplicationAdapter

    public abstract class AbstractFTPAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements ApplicationAdapter
    Implements an ApplicationAdapter for addressing FTP protocol files, based on the java.net package and it.sauronsoftware.ftp4j package. The user needs to implement a single method String getUserLogin( String domain ) to supply the class with domain login data. Logins are remembered for the duration of a program session and must be supplied only once.

      • getUserLogin

        public abstract java.lang.String getUserLogin(java.lang.String domain)
        Subclasses supply user login data for a requested domain name. The format of the result must be "user:password". The convention is that a return value null indicates a user-cancel event while an empty string is an empty data operation request (which will lead to a connection exception thrown).
        Parameters:
        domain - String addressed Internet domain
        Returns:
        String formatted user login data "user:password"

      • list

        public java.lang.String[] list(java.lang.String trunk,
                               java.lang.String trail,
                               boolean recurse)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ApplicationAdapter
        Returns a list of full file paths from the directory system of this IO-context which all start with the text of trunk. trail is an optional additional selection criterion determining the file path ending. Directories are not included in the result list.
        Specified by:
        list in interface ApplicationAdapter
        Parameters:
        trunk - starting text of resulting file paths; if the path name of a directory is entered, it must end with a separator sign. (The behaviour if parameter is empty is context specific hence undefined)
        trail - if not null ending text of resulting file paths
        recurse - if true files of subdirectories are included
        Returns:
        String array of file paths in IO-context or null indicating this function is not supported
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
